Description: Fragment of a polychrome painted pavement (blue, green and yellow with details in red and black) representing two birds flying from a papyrus-thicket.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, Maru-Aten, The Water Court For context see: http://www.amarnaproject.com/pages/amarna_the_place/maru_aten/index.shtml
Curator's comments: Part of 1922,1014.47 Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I: 118 pl.XXXIX Published: James. Ancient Egypt: Land and Legacy. (1988). Fig. 64 James, et. al. British Museum Book of Flowers (1989). pp. 12-3, fig. 7 Shaw and Nicholson. The British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (2002). p. 27.
